Advertisement Sergio Marchionne , 58, caused a stir in Italy after saying Feb. 4 the Turin-based carmaker and Chrysler Group LLC may end up looking like one entity, possibly based in the U.S.. He later backtracked, saying no decision has been made and the issue would be dealt with no sooner than 2014. Fiat owns a 25 percent stake in Auburn Hills-based Chrysler.

or redistributed.) WINDSOR, Ontario( AP)- Chrysler is debating the future of its minivans even as it starts making the 2011 Dodge Grand Caravan and Chrysler Town and Country this week. We need to completely rethink the minivan, CEO Sergio Marchionne said Tuesday at the Canadian plant where Chrysler's minivans are made. "We need to retain all its functionality but make it much more versatile." Sergio Marchionne said that could mean new products

And then, putting on his David Stockman cape, Colin Powell said: Don't tell me you're going to freeze to a level. That usually is a very inefficient way of doing it. Tell me what you're going to cut, and nobody up there yet is being very, very candid about what they are going to cut to fix this problem. Secretary Colin Powell is quite right that entitlement programs are where the real money is. tried to claim that 90% of students didn't need the cash to make them stay on in further education. Mr Andy Burnham hailed the increase in the staying-on rate since the 1980s, telling MPs: In the last 10 years the EMA has played an important part in that progress. It has sent out an empowering message of hope that you can dare to dream, whoever you are and wherever you come from. But sustaining the progress has to be worked on. Instead it is about to be thrown into reverse. But Mr Michael Gove said Labour had failed to set out its position on a range of education policies and had instead focused on EMA despite the economic difficulties. Keep up to date with the news
